article_text:
THE DIGITAL PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION ACT, 2023
(NO. 22 OF 2023)
[11th August, 2023.]
An Act to provide for the processing of digital personal data in a manner that
recognises both the right of individuals to protect their personal data and the
need to process such personal data for lawful purposes and for matters
connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Seventy-fourth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:––
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY
1. (1) This Act may be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
(2)  It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification
in the Official Gazette, appoint and different dates may be appointed for different provisions
of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall
be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.

requirement: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 is enacted by Parliament.
requirement_description: This requirement signifies that a new law has been passed to regulate the processing of digital personal data.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023
controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive data protection program that adheres to the requirements of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023
Collect only necessary and relevant personal data for the intended purpose and retain such data for limited periods as required by law or for business needs
Maintain accurate, complete, and up-to-date personal data in your possession or under your control and take appropriate measures to protect the integrity of such data

controls.control_title: Implement Data Access and Control Measures
controls.control: Provide individuals with reasonable access to their personal data, allow them to correct or amend inaccurate information, and provide mechanisms for the secure destruction of such data when it is no longer needed
Provide individuals with portable copies of their personal data in a machine-readable format and allow them to transmit this data to another data controller without hindrance
Establish procedures for the timely notification of individuals, supervisory authorities, and other relevant parties in case of a data breach

controls.control_title: Document Decisions of the Data Protection Board

controls.control_title: Document Decisions Made by the Data Protection Board
controls.control: Maintain records of decisions made during board meetings, including rationale and outcomes, for future reference and accountability purposes.

Integrate data protection measures into the design of systems, processes, and services that involve personal data.
Maintain records of processing activities, including purposes, categories of data subjects, types of personal data, and recipients.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Data Processing Practices

controls.control_title: Provide Regular Updates to the Data Fiduciary
controls.control: Regularly inform the Data Fiduciary about data processing activities, any breaches or incidents, and changes in your data processing practices.

requirement_title: Processing of Digital Personal Data Within India
article_text:
3. Subject to the provisions of this Act, it shall—
(a) apply to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India
where the personal data is collected––
(i) in digital form; or
(ii) in non-digital form and digitised subsequently;
(b) also apply to processing of digital personal data outside the territory of
India, if such processing is in connection with any activity related to offering of
goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India;
Application
of Act.
requirement: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data within India, whether it's originally in digital form or converted into digital format.
requirement_description: Organizations must comply with this requirement by ensuring that they follow the provisions of the Act when processing digital personal data within India.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Indian Data Protection Law
controls.control: Implement measures to ensure that all digital personal data processed within India complies with the relevant provisions of the applicable Indian data protection law.
Store and process digital personal data within India, unless an exception applies under the relevant Indian data protection law.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Integrate data protection principles into the design and development of systems and processes that handle digital personal data.
Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments for high-risk processing activities involving digital personal data.

Establish procedures to handle requests from data subjects regarding their rights under the Indian data protection law, such as access, correction, erasure, and portability of their digital personal data.
Implement procedures for promptly notifying the relevant authorities and affected data subjects in case of a data breach involving digital personal data.

requirement: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data outside India when it's connected to offering goods or services to individuals within India.
requirement_description: Organizations must comply with this requirement by ensuring that they follow the provisions of the Act when processing digital personal data outside India if it's related to offering goods or services to individuals within India.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Indian Data Protection Law
controls.control: Implement measures to ensure that the processing of digital personal data outside India complies with the requirements of the applicable Indian data protection law, particularly when offering goods or services to individuals within India.
Designate a Data Protection Officer (DPO) responsible for overseeing compliance with the Indian data protection law and acting as a point of contact for any related inquiries.

Provide mechanisms to allow individuals within India to exercise their rights under the Indian data protection law, such as accessing, correcting, erasing, or objecting to the processing of their personal data.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments
controls.control: Perform regular Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) to identify and mitigate potential privacy risks associated with the processing of personal data.

controls.control_title: Implement Appropriate Technical and Organizational Measures
controls.control: Adopt appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, such as encryption, access controls, and regular backups.

6. (1) The consent given by the Data Principal shall be free, specific, informed,

Protection Board of India. Part ( ii) of the consent , relating to waiver of her right to file a
complaint, shall be invalid.

thereunder shall be presented to the Data Principal in a clear and plain language, giving her

website for placing orders, but may not stop the processing for supply of the goods already
ordered and paid for by X.

article_text:
7. A Data Fiduciary may process personal data of a Data Principal for any of following
uses, namely:—
(a) for the specified purpose for which the Data Principal has voluntarily
provided her personal data to the Data Fiduciary, and in respect of which she has not
indicated to the Data Fiduciary that she does not consent to the use of her personal
data.
Illustrations.
(I) X, an individual, makes a purchase at Y, a pharmacy. She voluntarily provides Y her
personal data and requests Y to acknowledge receipt of the payment made for the purchase
by sending a message to her mobile phone. Y may process the personal data of X for the
purpose of sending the receipt.
(II) X, an individual, electronically messages Y , a real estate broker, requesting Y to
help identify a suitable rented accommodation for her and shares her personal data for this
purpose. Y may process her personal data to identify and intimate to  her the details of
accommodation available on rent. Subsequently, X informs Y that X no longer needs help
from Y . Y shall cease to process the personal data of X;
  (b) for the State and any of its instrumentalities to provide or issue to the Data
Principal such subsidy, benefit, service, certificate, licence or permit as may be
prescribed, where––
(i) she has previously consented to the processing of her personal data
by the State or any of its instrumentalities for any subsidy, benefit, service,
certificate, licence or permit; or
(ii) such personal data is available in digital form in, or in non-digital form
and digitised subsequently from, any database, register, book or other document
which is maintained by the State or any of its instrumentalities and is notified
by the Central Government,
subject to standards followed for processing being in accordance with the policy
issued by the Central Government or any law for the time being in force for governance
of personal data.

article_text:

(c) for the performance by the State or any of its instrumentalities of any function
under any law for the time being in force in India or in the interest of sovereignty and
integrity of India or security of the State;
(d) for fulfilling any obligation under any law for the time being in force in India
on any person to disclose any information to the State or any of its instrumentalities,
subject to such processing being in accordance with the provisions regarding
disclosure of such information in any other law for the time being in force;
(e) for compliance with any judgment or decree or order issued under any law
for the time being in force in India, or any judgment or order relating to claims of a
contractual or civil nature under any law for the time being in force outside India;
(f) for responding to a medical emergency involving a threat to the life or
immediate threat to the health of the Data Principal or any other individual;
 (g) for taking measures to provide medical treatment or health services to any
individual during an epidemic, outbreak of disease, or any other threat to public
health;
(h) for taking measures to ensure safety of, or provide assistance or services to,
any individual during any disaster, or any breakdown of public order.
Explanation.— For the purposes of this clause, the expression “disaster” shall
have the same meaning as assigned to it in clause ( d) of section 2 of the Disaster
Management Act, 2005; or
(i) for the purposes of employment or those related to safeguarding the employer
from loss or liability, such as prevention of corporate espionage, maintenance of
confidentiality of trade secrets, intellectual property, classified information or provision
of any service or benefit sought by a Data Principal who is an employee.

requirement_description: The organization must implement measures to prevent corporate espionage, maintain confidentiality of trade secrets, intellectual property, classified information, and provide services or benefits as sought by employees.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive disaster recovery plan that outlines steps to be taken in the event of a disaster, including data backup and restoration procedures, communication protocols, and employee safety measures.
Draft employment contracts that clearly outline the terms and conditions of employment, including any relevant disaster management policies.
Offer regular training sessions to employees on disaster preparedness, emergency response procedures, and safety protocols.
Keep accurate and up-to-date employment records for all staff members, including contact information, emergency contacts, and relevant skills or qualifications.

controls.control: Appoint a DPO responsible for ensuring compliance with data protection laws, acting as the primary point of contact for all data-related inquiries.
Conduct DPIAs to identify and mitigate potential privacy risks before starting new projects that involve personal data processing.

controls.control_title: Ensure Lawful Basis for Data Processing

Create a system for handling DSARs, allowing individuals to access, correct, or delete their personal data as required by law.

Regularly audit and monitor the Data Processor's compliance with the contractual obligations, data protection laws, and best practices.
Keep accurate records of all contracts with Data Processors, including amendments, renewals, and terminations.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive program to ensure the accuracy and consistency of personal data, including regular audits, validation checks, and correction processes.
Create a standardized format for collecting and storing personal data to ensure consistency across all sources.
Establish clear guidelines for data entry, including validation rules and input masking, to minimize errors during data collection.
Offer regular training sessions to staff members involved in data handling to ensure they understand the importance of data quality and how to maintain it.

Encrypt personal data both at rest and in transit using strong encryption algorithms.
Regularly backup all personal data to ensure its availability and recoverability in case of a disaster or breach.

Use encryption methods to protect sensitive personal data, both at rest and in transit.

controls.control: Develop and implement a clear, concise, and well-documented procedure for reporting personal data breaches to the relevant authorities within the required timeframe.
Assign a dedicated individual or team responsible for managing and coordinating breach reporting, ensuring timely and accurate communication.
Create a comprehensive response plan outlining steps to be taken in the event of a personal data breach, including containment, investigation, and remediation.

requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary is obligated to delete personal data when it is no longer necessary for compliance with any law, or when the Data Principal withdraws their consent.

controls.control: Implement a mechanism to erase personal data from all systems and backups when the Data Principal withdraws consent, as per the requirement of not retaining personal data beyond its necessity.
Develop an automated process to initiate data erasure upon receipt of a request from the Data Principal for consent withdrawal, ensuring prompt and accurate execution.
Establish a process to verify that the erased data cannot be restored or accessed in any way, and confirm its complete removal from all relevant systems and backups.

Inform the Data Principal about the successful erasure of their personal data upon consent withdrawal, ensuring transparency and maintaining trust in the Data Fiduciary's compliance with privacy regulations.

requirement: Data Erasure upon Purpose Cessation
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must erase the personal data it provided for processing once the specified purpose is no longer being served.

controls.control: Develop and enforce a secure data deletion procedure that ensures all personal data is irreversibly deleted upon the purpose for which it was collected being fulfilled.
Establish and regularly review data retention policies to ensure that personal data is not retained beyond the purpose for which it was collected.
Document all data erasure procedures and make them available to relevant personnel, ensuring that they understand and follow these procedures.

requirement: Legal Record Retention
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must retain personal data if required by law for a specified period.

controls.control: Develop and document a retention policy that outlines the types of records to be retained, the minimum and maximum retention periods for each type of record, and any legal or regulatory requirements.

Establish a system for managing records that includes procedures for creating, receiving, maintaining, retrieving, using, transmitting, and disposing of records in accordance with the retention policy.

Store records securely to prevent unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction. This may include physical security measures such as locks and alarms, as well as digital security measures such as encryption.
Regularly review records to ensure they are still necessary and relevant, and dispose of any records that are no longer required in accordance with the retention policy.

Implement a backup and disaster recovery plan to ensure that records can be recovered in the event of data loss or destruction. This may include regular backups, off-site storage, and a plan for restoring data in the event of a disaster.

requirement: Data Principal Inactivity Timeout
requirement_description: If the Data Principal does not approach the Data Fiduciary or exercise their rights within a specified time period, the purpose for processing their data may be considered no longer served.

controls.control: Automatically log out users after a specified period of inactivity to prevent unauthorized access.
Set up monitoring systems to detect and enforce idle timeouts for user sessions, and alert administrators if a session remains active beyond the specified limit.
Send reminders or notifications to users when they approach the inactivity timeout, allowing them to extend their session if needed.

requirement: Publication of Contact Information

controls.control_title: Publish Necessary and Accurate Contact Information
controls.control: Make sure to publish only essential contact information such as email addresses, phone numbers, physical addresses, or social media handles. Ensure the published information is accurate and up-to-date.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Minimization for Contact Information
controls.control: Limit the amount of contact information collected from users to only what is necessary. Avoid collecting sensitive personal data unless strictly required.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Published Contact Information
controls.control: Periodically review and update the published contact information to ensure it remains accurate, relevant, and secure. This helps maintain trust with users and stakeholders.

requirement: Grievance Redress Mechanism
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must have a system in place to address and resolve any grievances raised by the Data Principal.

controls.control_title: Establish a Centralized Grievance Redressal System
controls.control: Create a single point of contact (POC) for all grievances, ensuring prompt and consistent response.
Establish clear guidelines for escalating unresolved grievances to higher authorities within the organization.
Ensure that all grievance details are handled confidentially, and only relevant personnel have access to the information.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Grievance Procedures
controls.control: Periodically review and update grievance procedures to ensure they remain effective and efficient.

controls.control_title: Provide Training for Staff Involved in Grievance Handling
controls.control: Offer regular training sessions for staff members who handle grievances, ensuring they are well-versed with the procedures and policies.

requirement: A Data Principal must initiate contact with the Data Fiduciary to establish or continue a specified purpose.
requirement_description: The Data Principal's lack of contact with the Data Fiduciary during a certain period implies that they have not approached the Data Fiduciary for any specified purpose.

controls.control: Develop a standardized, secure, and compliant method for Data Principals to initiate contact with the Data Fiduciary.
Maintain a clear and concise record of the specified purpose for which the Data Principal is authorized to access or use the data.
Regularly review and update the specified purpose as necessary, ensuring it remains relevant and compliant with all applicable regulations.

requirement_title: Obtain Verifiable Consent for Processing Personal Data of Children or Persons with Disabilities
article_text:
9. (1) The Data Fiduciary shall, before processing any personal data of a child or a
person with disability who has a lawful guardian obtain verifiable consent of the parent of
such child or the lawful guardian, as the case may be, in such manner as may be prescribed.
Explanation.—For the purpose of this sub-section, the expression “consent  of the
parent” includes the consent of lawful guardian, wherever applicable.
(2) A Data Fiduciary shall not undertake such processing of personal data that is
likely to cause any detrimental effect on the well-being of a child.
(3) A Data Fiduciary shall not undertake tracking or behavioural monitoring of children
or targeted advertising directed at children.
(4) The provisions of sub-sections (1) and (3) shall not be applicable to processing of
personal data of a child by such classes of Data Fiduciaries or for such purposes, and
subject to such conditions, as may be prescribed.
(5) The Central Government may, if satisfied that a Data Fiduciary has ensured that its
processing of personal data of children is done in a manner that is verifiably safe, notify for
such processing by such Data Fiduciary the age above which that Data Fiduciary shall be
exempt from the applicability of all or any of the obligations under sub-sections (1) and (3)
in respect of processing by that Data Fiduciary as the notification may specify.

requirement_title: Data Principal's Right to Correction, Completion, Updating and Erasure
article_text:
12. (1) A Data Principal shall have the right to correction, completion, updating and
erasure of her personal data for the processing of which she has previously given consent,
including consent as referred to in clause (a) of section 7, in accordance with any requirement
or procedure under any law for the time being in force.
(2) A Data Fiduciary shall, upon receiving a request for correction, completion or
updating from a Data Principal,—
(a) correct the inaccurate or misleading personal data;
(b) complete the incomplete personal data; and
(c) update the personal data.
(3) A Data Principal shall make a request in such manner as may be prescribed to the
Data Fiduciary for erasure of her personal data, and upon receipt of such a request, the Data
Fiduciary shall erase her personal data unless retention of the same is necessary for the
specified purpose or for compliance with any law for the time being in force.
requirement: The Data Principal has the right to correction, completion, updating and erasure of her personal data
requirement_description: The Data Principal has the authority to request changes or deletion of their personal data if they have previously given consent for its processing.

13. (1) A Data Principal shall have the right to have readily available means of grievance
redressal provided by a Data Fiduciary or Consent Manager in respect of any act or omission
of such Data Fiduciary or Consent Manager regarding the performance of its obligations in
relation to the personal data of such Data Principal or the exercise of her rights under the
provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder.
(2) The Data Fiduciary or Consent Manager shall respond to any grievances referred
to in sub-section (1) within such period as may be prescribed from the date of its receipt for
all or any class of Data Fiduciaries.
(3) The Data Principal shall exhaust the opportunity of redressing her grievance
under this section before approaching the Board.

requirement_description: Data Principals are required to resolve their grievances through the established mechanisms before escalating them to the regulatory board.

controls.control_title: Follow Internal Grievance Procedures Before Approaching Regulatory Body
controls.control: Establish and document clear internal grievance procedures for handling complaints, ensure all employees are trained on these procedures, and enforce their use before any external regulatory body is approached.
Maintain a record of all grievances handled through the internal procedures, including the date, nature of the grievance, and resolution, for future reference and compliance audits.

controls.control_title: Communicate Internal Grievance Procedures to Data Principals
controls.control: Make the internal grievance procedures easily accessible to data principals, such as through a publicly available policy or during onboarding processes.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Internal Grievance Procedures Regularly
controls.control: Regularly review and update the internal grievance procedures to ensure they remain effective, relevant, and compliant with any changes in regulations.

issued by the State or any of its instrumentalities;

Data Fiduciary or the Board; and
(e) to furnish only such information as is verifiably authentic, while exercising

thereunder.

requirement_description: Organizations must keep detailed records of their adherence to the provisions outlined in this document for auditing and review purposes.

controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive policy that outlines the types of records to be maintained, retention periods, and disposal procedures.

controls.control_title: Implement Access Controls for Compliance Records
controls.control: Establish access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can view, modify, or delete compliance records.

requirement: Internal control implementation
requirement_description: Organizations must create, enforce, and update their internal controls to ensure effective management of risks and compliance with regulations.

controls.control_title: Establish and Maintain Internal Control Framework
controls.control: Develop, implement, and maintain an effective internal control framework that aligns with industry best practices and regulatory requirements.
Ensure that no single individual has the ability to perform all critical tasks, thereby reducing the risk of fraud or error.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Internal Controls
controls.control: Conduct periodic reviews of internal controls to ensure they remain effective and relevant in light of changes within the organization.
Establish and enforce access controls to ensure that only authorized individuals can access sensitive information or perform critical tasks.
Develop, implement, and maintain a change management process to ensure that all changes to systems, applications, and data are properly authorized, tested, and documented.

requirement_title: Restriction on Transfer of Personal Data Outside India
article_text:
16. (1) The Central Government may, by notification, restrict the transfer of personal
data by a Data Fiduciary for processing to such country or territory outside India as may be
so notified.
(2) Nothing contained in this section shall restrict the applicability of any law for the
time being in force in India that provides for a higher degree of protection for or restriction
on transfer of personal data by a Data Fiduciary outside India in relation to any personal
data or Data Fiduciary or class thereof.
requirement: The Central Government may restrict the transfer of personal data outside India
requirement_description: The government has the authority to limit the transfer of personal data to specific countries or territories

controls.control_title: Restrict Transfer of Personal Data Outside India
controls.control: Implement technical and organizational measures to prevent the unauthorized transfer of personal data outside India, except when it is necessary for the performance of a contract or for important reasons related to the data subject's legitimate interests.
Enter into agreements with recipients outside India that ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data, in compliance with the applicable data protection laws and regulations.

Classify personal data according to its sensitivity and implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access it, with a special focus on limiting access to personal data stored or processed outside India.
Encrypt personal data when transferred outside India, using strong encryption algorithms and secure key management practices.

requirement: Indian laws providing higher protection for data may still apply when transferring data outside India
requirement_description: Even if the government allows data transfer, existing Indian laws that offer a higher degree of protection or restrictions on such transfers remain applicable

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Indian Data Protection Laws
controls.control: Conduct a thorough review of the data being transferred to ensure it complies with relevant Indian laws, such as the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019. This may involve anonymizing or encrypting sensitive data.

Enter into agreements with recipients outside India that ensure the protection of transferred data in line with Indian laws. These agreements should cover aspects such as data security, access, and liability.
Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect the transferred data in accordance with Indian laws. This may include encryption, access controls, and regular security audits.
Inform data subjects about their rights under Indian data protection laws when their data is being transferred outside India. This may include the right to access, correct, or delete their data.

requirement_title: Exemption for Enforcing Legal Rights or Claims
article_text:
17. (1) The provisions of Chapter II, except sub-sections (1) and (5) of section 8, and
those of Chapter III and section 16 shall not apply where—
(a) the processing of personal data is necessary for enforcing any legal right or
claim;
(b) the processing of personal data by any court or tribunal or any other body
in India which is entrusted by law with the performance of any judicial or quasi-judicial
or regulatory or supervisory function, where such processing is necessary for the
performance of such function;
(c) personal data is processed in the interest of prevention, detection,
investigation or prosecution of any offence or contravention of any law for the time
being in force in India;
(d) personal data of Data Principals not within the territory of India is processed
pursuant to any contract entered into with any person outside the territory of India
by any person based in India;
(e) the processing is necessary for a scheme of compromise or arrangement or
merger or amalgamation of two or more companies or a reconstruction by way of
demerger or otherwise of a company, or transfer of undertaking of one or more company
to another company, or involving division of one or more companies, approved by a
court or tribunal or other authority competent to do so by any law for the time being
in force; and
(f) the processing is for the purpose of ascertaining the financial information
and assets and liabilities of any person who has defaulted in payment due on account
of a loan or advance taken from a financial institution, subject to such processing
being in accordance with the provisions regarding disclosure of information or data
in any other law for the time being in force.
Explanation.— For the purposes of this clause, the expressions “default” and
“financial institution” shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in
sub-sections (12) and (14) of section 3 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016.

controls.control_title: Ensure Legal Necessity of Data Processing

controls.control_title: Document Legal Basis for Data Processing

Establish and enforce appropriate retention periods for personal data, ensuring that it is only kept as long as necessary to fulfill the legal right or claim.
Conduct periodic reviews of all personal data processing activities to ensure that they remain necessary for enforcing any legal rights or claims.

requirement_title: Establishment of Data Protection Board of India
article_text:
CHAPTER V
D
ATA PROTECTION BOARD OF INDIA
18. (1) With effect from such date as the Central Government may, by notification,
appoint, there shall be established, for the purposes of this Act, a Board to be called the
Data Protection Board of India.
(2) The Board shall be a body corporate by the name aforesaid, having perpetual
succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire,
hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and to contract and shall, by
the said name, sue or be sued.
(3) The headquarters of the Board shall be at such place as the Central Government
may notify.
19. (1) The Board shall consist of a Chairperson and such number of other Members
as the Central Government may notify.
(2) The Chairperson and other Members shall be appointed by the Central Government
in such manner as may be prescribed.
(3) The Chairperson and other Members shall be a person of ability, integrity and
standing who possesses special knowledge or practical experience in the fields of data
governance, administration or implementation of laws related to social or consumer
protection, dispute resolution, information and communication technology, digital economy,
law, regulation or techno-regulation, or in any other field which in the opinion of the Central
Government may be useful to the Board, and at least one among them shall be an expert in
the field of law.
20. ( 1) The salary, allowances and other terms and conditions of service of the
Chairperson and other Members shall be such as may be prescribed, and shall not be varied
to their disadvantage after their appointment.
(2) The Chairperson and other Members shall hold office for a term of two years and
shall be eligible for re-appointment.

requirement_title: Eligibility Criteria for Chairperson or Member
article_text:
21. (1) A person shall be disqualified for being appointed and continued as the
Chairperson or a Member, if she—
(a) has been adjudged as an insolvent;
(b) has been convicted of an offence, which in the opinion of the Central
Government, involves moral turpitude;
(c) has become physically or mentally incapable of acting as a Member;
(d) has acquired such financial or other interest, as is likely to affect prejudicially
her functions as a Member; or
(e) has so abused her position as to render her continuance in office prejudicial
to the public interest.
(2) The Chairperson or Member shall not be removed from her office by the Central
Government unless she has been given an opportunity of being heard in the matter.

article_text:
21. (1) A person shall be disqualified for being appointed and continued as the
Chairperson or a Member, if she—
(a) has been adjudged as an insolvent;
(b) has been convicted of an offence, which in the opinion of the Central
Government, involves moral turpitude;
(c) has become physically or mentally incapable of acting as a Member;
(d) has acquired such financial or other interest, as is likely to affect prejudicially
her functions as a Member; or
(e) has so abused her position as to render her continuance in office prejudicial
to the public interest.

controls.control_title: Document the Process for Case Presentation

requirement_title: Resignation Procedure for the Chairperson or Member
article_text:
22. (1) The Chairperson or any other Member may give notice in writing to the Central
Government of resigning from her office, and such resignation shall be effective from the
date on which the Central Government permits her to relinquish office, or upon expiry of a
period of three months from the date of receipt of such notice, or upon a duly appointed
successor entering upon her office, or upon the expiry of the term of her office, whichever
is earliest.
(2) A vacancy caused by the resignation or removal or death of the Chairperson or
any other Member, or otherwise, shall be filled by fresh appointment in accordance with the
provisions of this Act.
(3) The Chairperson and any other Member shall not, for a period of one year from the
date on which they cease to hold such office, except with the previous approval of the
Central Government, accept any employment, and shall also disclose to the Central
Government any subsequent acceptance of employment with any Data Fiduciary against
whom proceedings were initiated by or before such Chairperson or other Member.
requirement: The Chairperson or any Member may resign from their office

Make the resignation procedure and related policies easily accessible to all chairpersons and members, ensuring they are aware of their rights and responsibilities in this regard.

inquiry, it may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, inquire into the affairs of any person for

documents;
(c) inspecting any data, book, document, register, books of account or any
other document; and
(d) such other matters as may be prescribed.
(8) The Board or its officers shall not prevent access to any premises or take into
custody any equipment or any item that may adversely affect the day-to-day functioning of
a person.
(9) The Board may require the services of any police officer or any officer of the
Central Government or a State Government to assist it for the purposes of this section and
it shall be the duty of every such officer to comply with such requisition.
(10) During the course of the inquiry, if the Board considers it necessary, it may for
reasons to be recorded in writing, issue interim orders after giving the person concerned an

requirement_title: Filing an Appeal within the Specified Timeframe
article_text:
CHAPTER VII
A
PPEAL AND ALTERNATE DISPUTE RESOLUTION
29. (1) Any person aggrieved by an order or direction made by the Board under this
Act may prefer an appeal before the Appellate Tribunal.
(2) Every appeal under sub-section (1) shall be filed within a period of sixty days from
the date of receipt of the order or direction appealed against and it shall be in such form and
manner and shall be accompanied by such fee as may be prescribed.
(3) The Appellate Tribunal may entertain an appeal after the expiry of the period
specified in sub-section (2), if it is satisfied that there was sufficient cause for not preferring
the appeal within that period.
(4) On receipt of an appeal under sub-section ( 1), the Appellate Tribunal may, after
giving the parties to the appeal, an opportunity of being heard, pass such orders thereon as
it thinks fit, confirming, modifying or setting aside the order appealed against.

32. (1) The Board may accept a voluntary undertaking in respect of any matter related
to observance of the provisions of this Act from any person at any stage of a proceeding
under section 28.
(2) The voluntary undertaking referred to in sub-section ( 1) may include an
undertaking to take such action within such time as may be determined by the Board, or
refrain from taking such action, and or publicising such undertaking.
(3) The Board may, after accepting the voluntary undertaking and with the consent of
the person who gave the voluntary undertaking vary the terms included in the voluntary
undertaking.
(4) The acceptance of the voluntary undertaking by the Board shall constitute a bar
on proceedings under the provisions of this Act as regards the contents of the voluntary
undertaking, except in cases covered by sub-section ( 5).
(5) Where a person fails to adhere to any term of the voluntary undertaking accepted
by the Board, such breach shall be deemed to be breach of the provisions of this Act and
the Board may, after giving such person an opportunity of being heard, proceed in accordance
with the provisions of section 33.

(a) the nature, gravity and duration of the breach;

having regard to the need to secure observance of and deter breach of the provisions
of this Act; and
(g) the likely impact of the imposition of the monetary penalty on the person.
34. All sums realised by way of penalties imposed by the Board under this Act, shall
be credited to the Consolidated Fund of India.

35. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Central

information.

bound to comply with the same.

public to any information generated, transmitted, received, stored or hosted, in any
computer resource that enables such Data Fiduciary to carry on any activity relating
to offering of goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India,
after giving an opportunity of being heard to that Data Fiduciary, on being satisfied that it
is necessary or expedient so to do, in the interests of the general public, for reasons to be
recorded in writing, by order, direct any agency of the Central Government or any intermediary
to block for access by the public or cause to be blocked for access by the public any such
information.
(2) Every intermediary who receives a direction issued under sub-section (1) shall be
bound to comply with the same.
(3) For the purposes of this section, the expressions “computer resource”,
“information” and “intermediary” shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in
the Information Technology Act, 2000.

requirement: Guidelines for creating specific rules
requirement_description: The Central Government is provided with guidelines on what aspects they can include in the rules they create.

controls.control: Create rules that are clear, concise, and unambiguous to ensure consistent application.
Develop rule templates for common scenarios to promote consistency and efficiency in rule creation.
Maintain a log of rule changes, including the reason for the change, the date, and the person responsible.

requirement: Define the time period when a specified purpose is no longer served
requirement_description: An organization must define the time period after which a specified purpose for processing personal data is considered to be no longer served

controls.control: Establish and enforce a data retention policy that specifies the maximum allowed time for storing personal data, after which it should be deleted or anonymized.
Conduct periodic reviews of stored personal data to ensure that it is still necessary for the specified purpose and delete/anonymize any data that no longer serves its intended purpose.
Archive data that needs to be kept for legal or compliance reasons, but is no longer actively used. Ensure the archived data is protected and only accessible when necessary.

requirement_title: Publishing Business Contact Information of Data Protection Officer
requirement: Publish the business contact information of the Data Protection Officer
requirement_description: An organization must publish the business contact information of its Data Protection Officer to facilitate communication and inquiries related to data protection

controls.control: Make the business contact information of the Data Protection Officer (name, title, email address, phone number, and physical location) publicly available on the company's website or in a readily accessible manner.
Ensure that the contact information of the Data Protection Officer is updated regularly to reflect any changes, such as a change in email address or phone number.

controls.control_title: Provide Multiple Contact Channels for DPO
controls.control: Offer multiple contact channels for the Data Protection Officer, such as email, phone, and physical mail, to accommodate various preferences of individuals seeking to contact them.

requirement: Obtain verifiable consent from data principals
requirement_description: An organization must obtain verifiable consent from data principals before processing their personal data

controls.control_title: Implement Explicit and Clear Consent Mechanisms
controls.control: Develop user-friendly interfaces for users to provide explicit and informed consent before collecting their personal data
Create comprehensive, easily understandable privacy policies that outline how personal data will be used, shared, and protected
Offer users the ability to choose which types of communications or data processing they consent to
Maintain a record of consents obtained, including the data principal's identity, the type of consent given, and the date/time of consent
Regularly review and update consents to ensure they remain valid and relevant, and provide users with opportunities to revisit and modify their consents

requirement_title: Classes of Data Fiduciaries, Purposes, and Conditions for Processing Personal Data of a Child
requirement: Define classes of Data Fiduciaries, purposes, and conditions for processing personal data of children
requirement_description: An organization must define the classes of Data Fiduciaries, purposes, and conditions under which they can process the personal data of children

controls.control: Categorize individuals or organizations responsible for the handling of personal data into distinct classes based on their roles and responsibilities.

controls.control_title: Establish Purposes for Processing Personal Data
controls.control: Define clear, specific, and lawful purposes for the collection, use, retention, and disposal of personal data of children.

controls.control_title: Determine Conditions for Processing Personal Data
controls.control: Establish appropriate conditions under which the processing of personal data of children will occur, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

controls.control_title: Document Data Fiduciary Classes, Purposes, and Conditions
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of data fiduciary classes, purposes, and conditions for processing personal data of children.

Regularly review and update the defined classes of data fiduciaries, purposes, and conditions for processing personal data of children to ensure ongoing compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Offer training and awareness programs to employees and relevant stakeholders on the importance of adhering to defined classes, purposes, and conditions for processing personal data of children.

requirement: Follow the Data Protection Impact Assessment process
requirement_description: An organization must follow the Data Protection Impact Assessment process to identify and mitigate potential data protection risks

controls.control: Regularly review and update Data Protection Impact Assessments to ensure they remain current and relevant.
Designate a specific individual or team responsible for conducting and overseeing the Data Protection Impact Assessments.
Thoroughly document findings from each Data Protection Impact Assessment, including any risks identified and mitigation strategies implemented.
Offer training to relevant staff members on the Data Protection Impact Assessment process and their role in it.

requirement_title: Measures Undertaken by Significant Data Fiduciary
requirement: Undertake additional measures as a Significant Data Fiduciary
requirement_description: A Significant Data Fiduciary must undertake additional measures to ensure data protection beyond the general requirements

controls.control: Appoint a DPO to oversee and ensure compliance with data protection regulations
Regularly assess the risk associated with processing personal data and implement appropriate mitigation strategies
Conduct DPIAs for high-risk processing activities to identify and minimize potential harm to data subjects
Encrypt sensitive personal data both at rest and in transit to protect against unauthorized access
Develop and implement a data retention policy that outlines the duration for which personal data will be stored

requirement_title: Request for Information and Personal Data by Data Principal
requirement: Respond to requests for information and personal data by Data Principals
requirement_description: An organization must respond to requests from data principals regarding their personal data and its processing

controls.control_title: Establish a Process for Handling Data Requests
controls.control: Develop and document a clear process for handling requests from Data Principals, including timelines and escalation procedures.
Assign a specific individual or team to handle data requests and ensure they are properly trained and equipped to do so.

controls.control_title: Maintain an Up-to-date Inventory of Personal Data
controls.control: Regularly update the inventory of personal data collected, stored, or processed, making it easily accessible for data requests.
Use a system to track and manage all data requests, ensuring they are responded to in a timely manner and the status is communicated to the Data Principal.
Understand and adhere to all relevant laws, regulations, and contracts regarding data access and disclosure, including any applicable timeframes.

requirement_title: Request for Erasure of Personal Data by Data Principal
requirement: Comply with requests for erasure of personal data by Data Principals
requirement_description: An organization must comply with requests from data principals to erase their personal data

controls.control: Develop and document a clear procedure for handling data erasure requests from Data Principals, including timelines and steps to ensure compliance.
Ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, and provide mechanisms for Data Principals to access their own data and request erasure.
Implement a system to verify that the requested data has been successfully erased from all relevant systems, databases, and backups.
Maintain records of data erasure requests, including timestamps, requestor information, and confirmation that the data has been successfully erased.

requirement: Respond to grievances within a specified timeframe
requirement_description: An organization must respond to data principals' grievances related to data protection within the specified timeframe

controls.control_title: Establish Service Level Agreement for Grievance Response Time
controls.control: Define and communicate clear service level agreements (SLAs) outlining the maximum response time for addressing grievances, and ensure that all relevant teams are aware of these SLAs.
Create a system to track grievances from receipt through resolution, ensuring timely follow-up and communication with the grievant.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Grievance Response Processes
controls.control: Periodically review and update grievance response processes to ensure efficiency, effectiveness, and adherence to the established SLA.

requirement_title: Consistency with Other Laws and Bar of Jurisdiction
requirement: Ensure consistency with other applicable laws and understand the bar of jurisdiction
requirement_description: An organization must ensure that its data protection practices are consistent with all relevant laws and understand any limitations on its jurisdiction

controls.control: Conduct regular reviews of all applicable laws and regulations to ensure compliance. This includes but is not limited to data protection, privacy, and jurisdictional laws.

controls.control_title: Establish a Legal Team or Consultant
controls.control: Engage a legal team or external consultant to provide guidance on compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Document all efforts made towards understanding and complying with applicable laws and regulations, including dates of reviews, changes in laws, and actions taken.

requirement: Have the power to make rules related to data protection
requirement_description: An organization may have the authority to make rules or regulations related to data protection, as permitted by the governing body

controls.control: Create a dedicated committee responsible for making, enforcing, and updating data protection policies
Categorize data based on sensitivity and risk level to ensure appropriate protection measures are in place
Offer regular training sessions for employees to educate them about data protection policies and best practices

requirement: Follow the specified procedure for nominating a representative by the Data Principal as per Section 14, Sub-Section 1.
requirement_description: The Data Principal must follow the prescribed method to appoint another individual to represent them.

controls.control: Ensure that the Data Principal follows the specified procedure for nominating a representative as per Section 14, Sub-Section 1.
Maintain accurate records of the nominated representative and the date of nomination for future reference.
Inform the nominated representative about their role and responsibilities, and provide them with necessary access to data and systems.

requirement_title: Exemption Standards for Personal Data Processing
requirement: Adhere to the specified standards when seeking an exemption for personal data processing as per Section 17, Clause (b), Sub-Section 2.
requirement_description: The organization must meet certain criteria when requesting an exemption for personal data processing.

controls.control: Develop and document clear, specific, and objective criteria for seeking an exemption under Section 17, Clause (b), Sub-Section 2.
Perform a thorough risk assessment to evaluate the potential impact of the exemption on data privacy and security.
Prepare a detailed, well-documented request for exemption, including justification, risk assessment, and proposed measures to mitigate risks.
Maintain accurate records of all exemptions granted, their scope, duration, and any conditions attached.
Establish a process for regular review of granted exemptions to ensure they remain valid and necessary.

requirement: Follow the specified procedure for appointing the Chairperson and other members of the Board as per Section 19, Sub-Section 2.
requirement_description: The appointment process for the Board's Chairperson and Members must be conducted according to the prescribed method.

controls.control: Ensure the appointment of the Chairperson follows the specified procedure outlined in Section 19, Sub-Section 2.

controls.control_title: Appoint Board Members as per Procedure
controls.control: Ensure all other members of the Board are appointed following the specified procedure outlined in Section 19, Sub-Section 2.
Maintain a record of the appointment process for both the Chairperson and Board members, including relevant details such as date, method of appointment, and any supporting documentation.
Periodically review and update the appointment procedure for the Chairperson and Board members to ensure it remains current and effective.
Make the appointment procedure easily accessible to all relevant parties, such as employees or stakeholders, to promote transparency and understanding.

requirement_title: Salary, Allowances, and Terms of Service for Board Members
requirement: Comply with the specified salary, allowances, and terms & conditions of service for the Board's Chairperson and Members as per Section 20, Sub-Section 1.
requirement_description: The remuneration and employment conditions for the Board's Chairperson and Members must adhere to the prescribed guidelines.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Salary, Allowances, and Terms & Conditions for Board Members
controls.control: Establish and maintain a clear policy that outlines the salary, allowances, and terms & conditions of service for the Board's Chairperson and Members. Regularly review and update this policy as necessary to ensure compliance with Section 20, Sub-Section 1.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate Records of Salary and Allowances
controls.control: Implement a system for accurately recording and maintaining all salary and allowance payments made to the Board's Chairperson and Members. Regularly review these records to ensure compliance with the established policy.

controls.control_title: Provide Annual Training on Compliance Requirements
controls.control: Offer annual training sessions for Board members to educate them about the requirements of Section 20, Sub-Section 1 and their responsibilities in complying with these requirements.

requirement_title: Authentication of Orders, Directions, and Instruments
requirement: Follow the specified procedure for authenticating orders, directions, and instruments as per Section 23, Sub-Section 1.
requirement_description: The authentication process for orders, directions, and instruments must be conducted according to the prescribed method.

controls.control_title: Follow Authentication Procedure for Orders, Directions, and Instruments
controls.control: Ensure all orders, directions, and instruments are authenticated according to the specified procedure outlined in Section 23, Sub-Section 1. This includes verifying the identity of the sender and ensuring the integrity of the message.
Use two-factor authentication for all user accounts involved in order processing to add an additional layer of security.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Authentication Procedures
controls.control: Regularly review and update the authentication procedures to ensure they remain effective against current threats and comply with any changes in regulations.

requirement_title: Appointment and Service Conditions for Board Officers and Employees
requirement: Comply with the specified terms & conditions for appointing and serving officers and employees of the Board as per Section 24.
requirement_description: The employment conditions for officers and employees of the Board must adhere to the prescribed guidelines.

controls.control_title: Appoint Officers and Employees in Compliance with Terms & Conditions
controls.control: Ensure all officers and employees of the Board are appointed in accordance with the specified terms & conditions as per Section 24, and their appointments are properly documented.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review Officer and Employee Appointments
controls.control: Establish a process for regular review of officer and employee appointments to ensure they continue to meet the specified terms & conditions as per Section 24.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all officer and employee appointments, including the terms & conditions under which they were appointed.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Terms & Conditions for Officer and Employee Appointment
controls.control: Provide training to relevant personnel involved in officer and employee appointments regarding the specified terms & conditions as per Section 24.

requirement: Implement the specified techno-legal measures as per Section 28, Sub-Section 1.
requirement_description: The Board must implement the prescribed techno-legal measures to ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

controls.control: Encrypt all sensitive data at rest and in transit to protect it from unauthorized access
Define and enforce policies for user access, ensuring that only authorized individuals can access sensitive data
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with techno-legal measures and identify any potential vulnerabilities

requirement_title: Other Matters under Clause (d) of Section 28
requirement: Comply with any other matters specified under Clause (d) of Sub-Section 7 of Section 28.
requirement_description: The organization must adhere to any additional requirements specified under the prescribed clause.

controls.control: Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive compliance program to ensure adherence to all specified matters under Clause (d) of Sub-Section 7 of Section 28
Conduct regular internal and external audits to assess compliance with the specified matters under Clause (d) of Sub-Section 7 of Section 28
Document all compliance activities, decisions, and findings related to the specified matters under Clause (d) of Sub-Section 7 of Section 28 for future reference and review

requirement: Follow the specified procedure, format, and pay the required fee when filing an appeal as per Section 29, Sub-Section 2.
requirement_description: The appeals process, format, and associated fees must be followed when submitting an appeal.

controls.control_title: Follow Correct Procedure for Appeal Filing
controls.control: Ensure all appeals are filed according to the specified procedure outlined in Section 29, Sub-Section 2

controls.control_title: Maintain Correct Format for Appeal Documents
controls.control: Ensure all appeal documents adhere to the prescribed format as per Section 29, Sub-Section 2
Make sure to pay the required fee for filing an appeal within the specified timeframe as per Section 29, Sub-Section 2

requirement: Comply with the specified procedure for handling appeals as per Section 29, Sub-Section 8.
requirement_description: The organization must adhere to the prescribed process when dealing with submitted appeals.

controls.control_title: Establish Appeal Handling Procedure Compliance Team
controls.control: Designate a team responsible for ensuring all appeals are handled in accordance with Section 29, Sub-Section 8.
Create and maintain a written procedure outlining the steps for handling appeals as per Section 29, Sub-Section 8.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Appeal Handling Procedure
controls.control: Provide regular training to all relevant staff members on the appeal handling procedure outlined in Section 29, Sub-Section 8.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review Appeal Handling Compliance
controls.control: Regularly review and audit the handling of appeals to ensure compliance with Section 29, Sub-Section 8.

requirement_title: Rule and Notification Approval by Parliament
requirement: Rules and notifications must be approved by both Houses of Parliament within 30 days of being laid before them.
requirement_description: All rules and notifications made under Sections 16 and 42 must be approved by both Houses of Parliament, with the possibility of modifications or rejection.

controls.control_title: Parliamentary Approval of Rules and Notifications
controls.control: Ensure that all rules and notifications are approved by both Houses of Parliament within the stipulated 30-day period. This can be achieved by implementing a system for tracking the approval process, setting up reminders, and providing regular updates to the relevant parties.
Create a dedicated team responsible for liaising with both Houses of Parliament. This team should be able to provide timely updates, answer queries, and facilitate the approval process.
Develop and maintain clear documentation outlining the parliamentary approval process for rules and notifications. This will help ensure consistency and transparency in the process.

requirement: Ensure reasonable security measures are implemented to prevent personal data breaches
requirement_description: Data fiduciaries must implement appropriate security measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or loss.

controls.control: Encrypt all personal data at rest and in transit using strong encryption algorithms
Limit access to personal data only to authorized personnel, enforce strong password policies, and use multi-factor authentication where possible
Keep all systems, applications, and devices up-to-date with the latest security patches to protect against known vulnerabilities

controls.control_title: Implement Data Backup and Recovery Plan
controls.control: Regularly backup personal data and store backups securely. Have a disaster recovery plan in place to restore data quickly in case of breach or loss.
Regularly train employees on security best practices, including recognizing and reporting phishing attempts, safe internet usage, and handling personal data securely.

requirement_description: In the event of a personal data breach, data fiduciaries must inform the Data Protection Board and affected individuals without undue delay.

controls.control: Develop and document a clear procedure for identifying, reporting, and responding to personal data breaches within the required timeframe.
Establish a process for promptly notifying the Data Protection Board about any confirmed personal data breach, as required by law.
Develop a process for identifying and contacting all affected data principals in the event of a personal data breach.
Keep an up-to-date log of all confirmed personal data breaches, including details about the incident and any actions taken to address it.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Breach Response Plan
controls.control: Regularly review and update the organization's breach response plan to ensure it remains effective in addressing personal data breaches.

requirement: Adhere to additional obligations related to children's data protection
requirement_description: Data fiduciaries must comply with any additional obligations specified for handling children's personal data.

controls.control: Establish age verification processes to ensure that only individuals who meet the relevant age requirements for data protection are granted access to children's personal data
Obtain explicit and verifiable parental or guardian consent prior to collecting, using, or disclosing children's personal data
Collect only the minimum necessary personal data from children and ensure that such data is kept securely
Design and present content and interfaces in a manner that is appropriate for children, taking into account their level of maturity and understanding
Provide privacy settings and controls that allow parents or guardians to manage their child's personal data, including the ability to review, edit, or delete such data

requirement: Comply with additional obligations for significant data fiduciaries
requirement_description: Significant data fiduciaries must adhere to any additional obligations specified in the act.

controls.control: Collect only necessary personal data and retain for limited periods
Appoint a DPO to oversee data protection strategy, training, and compliance.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIA)
controls.control: Perform DPIAs for high-risk processing activities to identify and mitigate potential data protection risks.
Clearly inform individuals about the purposes, uses, and retention periods of their personal data.
Enable individuals to exercise their rights, such as access, rectification, erasure, and objection, in a timely manner.

requirement_description: Data fiduciaries must comply with any duties specified in section 15 of the act.

controls.control: Provide training to all relevant personnel on the specific duties outlined in section 15, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities.

controls.control_title: Assign Responsible Persons for Section 15 Compliance
controls.control: Designate clear points of contact within the organization who are responsible for ensuring compliance with section 15 duties.

controls.control_title: Develop and Implement Section 15 Policies and Procedures
controls.control: Create written policies and procedures that outline how the organization will comply with section 15 duties, and ensure they are communicated to all relevant personnel.
Establish a system for monitoring compliance with section 15 duties, and take corrective action when necessary.

requirement: Comply with terms of voluntary undertakings accepted by the Data Protection Board
requirement_description: Data fiduciaries must adhere to any terms agreed upon in voluntary undertakings presented to the Data Protection Board.

controls.control: Review and understand the terms of voluntary undertakings accepted by the Data Protection Board. Ensure all practices, policies, and procedures align with these terms.
Keep accurate records of the voluntary undertakings accepted, including their scope, timelines, and any specific requirements. Regularly update this documentation as necessary.
Appoint a designated compliance officer responsible for ensuring ongoing adherence to the terms of voluntary undertakings and liaising with the Data Protection Board as required.
Offer regular training sessions for staff to ensure they are aware of the terms of voluntary undertakings and understand their role in maintaining compliance.
Establish a process for regularly reviewing the status of compliance with the terms of voluntary undertakings and taking corrective action where necessary.

requirement: Adhere to all other provisions of the act and its regulations
requirement_description: Data fiduciaries must comply with all other provisions specified in the act and its related rules.

controls.control: Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive compliance program that adheres to all provisions of the act and its regulations.
Establish a process for regular review and update of the act's regulations to ensure ongoing compliance.
Develop and implement a training program to educate employees about the act and its regulations, emphasizing their importance and the need for compliance.
Create and enforce policies that align with the act's provisions, ensuring all operations are conducted in accordance with these policies.
Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential non-compliance areas and implement appropriate controls to mitigate these risks.
